Title: Power Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Summary Statement:
Working with a diverse team, you will play an integral role in designing, developing, and supporting our business critical applications, while mentoring associate engineers on software development best practices in an effort to deliver our next generation of innovative applications to our customers.
What You Will Be Doing:
As a Power Platform Engineer, you will participate in all aspects of the Software Development lifecycle by supporting existing software development efforts and troubleshooting issues as they occur while also developing new software modules across multiple small to medium projects concurrently. You will have an opportunity to lead the design of certain software components and suggest new products, applications and features based on industry and technological trends and advances. You will also consult with process owners in reviewing, interpreting & developing systems in accordance with user requirements. Finally, you will get an opportunity to work with a diverse team and mentor junior software engineers.

Title: Power Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
About Penske:
Most people know us for our big yellow trucks. But we’re so much more than that. At Penske we have a 50-plus year history of leading the transportation and supply-chain industry, delivering world-class and award-winning technology solutions and the key to our success is our people.

We are experiencing rapid business growth and have added headcounts to IT teams across the organization to keep up with this expansion. Going into Spring/Summer 2022, we are hiring immediately for full-time, long-term roles. At Penske you will ensure our technology solutions keep our company and our customers moving forward.

Title: Power Platform Engineer
Job_Description:
Manager - Software Development (Job Number: 2203571 )
Summary Statement:
You will manage a team of developers to help us create the next generation of innovative solutions while also enhancing and optimizing our existing systems and applications. Providing day-to-day management and development for your team, you will manage projects to ensure seamless delivery, implementation, support, and issue resolution. Using your knowledge and experience with the technology you will help guide our organization to implement solutions that will move us forward and keep us ahead of the competition.
What You Will Be Doing:
As a Penske manager software development, you will be leading a team focused on key software development, enhancements, and maintenance. Working with your teams, stakeholders, and development partners/vendors to ensure implementation and help define architectures to create robust solutions. Conducting performance reviews for your team and engineering process for quality assurance to ensure that deliverables are effective and meet the needs of the end-user. Guiding teams and removing roadblocks to ensure timely solutions, as well as, growing your team of developers to advance in their careers are key tasks that help make sure we can keep our organization moving forward. Fostering a partnership with business owners and key stakeholders to get the job done.
5401 West Kennedy Blvd Suite 700 5401 West Kennedy Blvd Suite 700

Title: Java Developer (eBusiness)
Job_Description:
As a Penske Test Engineer your primary focus will be on automating test execution and evaluating results. You will work with an agile development team as a primary contributor to development, integration, and deployment of automated system tests, ensuring quality, reliability, usability, and performance of new features. This will include participating in agile best practices and ceremonies, including use case development, story writing, grooming, and story pointing daily stand-ups, demos and retrospectives. Working under the direction of the Manager of QA and senior Automated QA Engineers, you will collaborate with other IT teams (product management, testing engineers, software engineers and architects) to provide input on end user and API interfaces and progress status reporting, as well as maintain a clear understanding of the applications business area and its requirements.

Requirements

Title: Digital Project Manager
Job_Description:
Digital Project Manager (Job Number: 2215152 )
Position Summary:
We are seeking an expert Project Manager to assist in developing, coordinating, and tracking work across a variety of areas that are critical to the Penske digital experience. This includes connected vehicle and customer data projects and tools that stretch across various functions of the business. You will work to ensure project momentum is thoughtful and optimized, processes are in place, communication is clear, events are planned, and materials are prepared. Communication skills are paramount. Expect to work with cross-functional teams at various levels within the organization. Relationship management with all levels of Penske management, partners, suppliers, subject matter experts, etc., will also be an important part of this role.
You will manage multiple projects and project activities to ensure that the goals and objectives are accomplished with quality results that meet or exceed expectations.
100 Gundy Drive 100 Gundy Drive

Title: Digital Project Manager
Job_Description:
Technical Project Manager (Job Number: 2222955 )
You may know Penske for our big yellow trucks. But did you know we’re an industry-leading technology innovation company? At Penske we have a 50-year history of leading the transportation and supply-chain industry, delivering world-class and award-winning technology solutions. And, it starts with our associates. No matter what your skills or technology stack, our IT team is for you. You’ll work and grow alongside great people and on really cool projects. We inspire our IT experts to push the boundaries, create possibilities, be innovative, and, most of all, to have fun. Ultimately, you’ll help develop and ensure our technology solutions keep our company and our customers moving forward. Do you have what IT takes?
Summary Statement:
You will act as a technical project manager working with the business to provide end to end project management guidance to facilitate the development and implementation of our products and services for internal and external customers.
5401 West Kennedy Blvd Suite 700 5401 West Kennedy Blvd Suite 700

Job_Description:
Agile Coach (Job Number: 2219039 )
Summary/Purpose:
This critical position is responsible for the transition of the entire organization to achieve business agility and will continue to define and execute the organizations muti-year agile transformation vision in alignment with lean agile principles. This role will engage stakeholders and senior leadership to ensure there is alignment between the organizations mission, vision, and technology initiatives through the forming and stabilization of high performing cross functional product teams. Through continual coaching on agile and software engineering practices product teams will provide high quality, customer focused, faster to market solutions that will allow Penske to maintain a competitive advantage in key areas of the business.

Title: Senior Talend Developer
Job_Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist) (Job Number: 2218578 )
Position Summary:
The Data Scientist/Senior Business Analyst - HR position will provide historical and predictive analytical support for the Human Resources business initiatives by providing insight to differences in our associate population, providing visibility to HR processes, measuring the impact of HR initiatives and establishing linkages to business performance. Analysis activity will include scenario planning, modeling and correlation analysis.
Major Responsibilities:
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis using traditional and advanced analytical models, tools and techniques, including trending, correlation, budgeting\financial planning, forecasting, and what-if scenario analysis, for field and corporate leadership.
100 Gundy Drive 100 Gundy Drive

Title: Associate Data Platform Engineer III
Job_Description:
Senior Data Platform Architect (Job Number: 2113976 )
What You Will Be Doing:
As a Penske Senior Data Platform Architect, you will be responsible for the technical design and technology roadmap for the company's data platform solutions and services. In this role, you will lead the data platform architecture strategy to provide data solutions and infrastructure that enable business intelligence, AI/ML Ops, IoT, data integrations, data services, self-service analytics, and data-driven digital products and services. You will be an owner and subject matter expert on one or more workstreams under data platform infrastructure. You will enable data productivity by building out data services on cloud and help to operationalize it. You will bring critical day-to-day leadership and thinking to the table, working with teams of architects, engineering leaders, and product managers, aligning cross-functional projects and ensuring that they're within reason (fiscally and technically). You will collaborate with internal teams and business leaders alike, creating strategically sound Target State Architectures.
5401 West Kennedy Blvd Suite 700 5401 West Kennedy Blvd Suite 700

Title: Test Engineer
Job_Description:
As a Penske Test Engineer your primary focus will be on automating test execution and evaluating results. You will work with an agile development team as a primary contributor to development, integration, and deployment of automated system tests, ensuring quality, reliability, usability, and performance of new features. This will include participating in agile best practices and ceremonies, including use case development, story writing, grooming, and story pointing daily stand-ups, demos and retrospectives. Working under the direction of the Manager of QA and senior Automated QA Engineers, you will collaborate with other IT teams (product management, testing engineers, software engineers and architects) to provide input on end user and API interfaces and progress status reporting, as well as maintain a clear understanding of the applications business area and its requirements.

Requirements

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Data Scientist (Job Number: 2215151 )
Position Summary
Supports customer analytics by implementing and managing day to day delivery of Customer Analytics including Customer Experience Metrics and Analysis, collaborate with offshore resources in the development of Customer Analytics data systems, data bases and design processes. The incumbent will also be responsible to develop methodology to model relationships between multivariate operational metrics, customer survey data, and customer experience data. Incumbent will perform complex quantitate and qualitative analysis to support customer experience improvement. Make recommendations regarding customer experience analytics.

Title: Data Scientist
Job_Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist) (Job Number: 2218578 )
Position Summary:
The Data Scientist/Senior Business Analyst - HR position will provide historical and predictive analytical support for the Human Resources business initiatives by providing insight to differences in our associate population, providing visibility to HR processes, measuring the impact of HR initiatives and establishing linkages to business performance. Analysis activity will include scenario planning, modeling and correlation analysis.
Major Responsibilities:
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis using traditional and advanced analytical models, tools and techniques, including trending, correlation, budgeting\financial planning, forecasting, and what-if scenario analysis, for field and corporate leadership.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist)
Job_Description:
Rental Operations Analyst (Job Number: 2222897 )
Position Summary:
Responsible for monitoring and analyzing the Commercial Rental product line. This role will gather and analyze financial, transactional and operational data, create dashboards and produce Corporate and field Ad-hoc reporting. Analyze data measuring past and current performance. This position is expected to work regularly with all leaders of the Rental organization as well as other internal support teams and will be proactive in generating information to drive process improvements.
Major Responsibilities:
Create and Maintain dashboards and reports for Corporate and Field Rental management. Work with Corporate and Field management to analyze quotes, transactions, revenue and fleet. Identify issues and provide solutions based on analysis performed. Establish and maintain Rental information in a centralized location.
100 Gundy Drive 100 Gundy Drive

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist)
Job_Description:
Analyst – Sales & Use Tax (Job Number: 2219344 )
Position Summary:
The Tax Analyst on the tax policy team is an integral member of the Fleet Services/ Operating Tax Organization. This dynamic position will be responsible for providing analysis and recommendations on various tax issues in the sales, use, and property tax disciplines. Additionally, this position will assist with research and tax planning. This role will develop and maintain the tax policy for Penske Logistics including definition of exemptions, tax treatment of transactions, controls, and remediation.
Major Responsibilities:
Respond to customer service-related tax issues
100 Gundy Drive 100 Gundy Drive

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Data Scientist)
Job_Description:
Senior Financial Analyst - Financial Planning & Analysis (Job Number: 2206041 )
Position Summary:
A Penske Senior Financial Analyst for the Financial Planning and Analysis (FPA) department provides analysis and related metrics for FPA's ongoing financial reporting and financial forecasting responsibilities. The position will require the ability to:
Design, develop, and maintain financial models which ensure reporting and process compliance requirements are met accurately and efficiently.
Query and analyze data from Penske's multiple data systems through the use of SQL and "Big Data" visualization software packages (eg, Qlikview, Tableau, Alteryx)
